articles.description: Former Louisiana-Lafayette OL O'Cyrus Torrence, who was an All-Sun Belt selection the last two years, will be reunited with Gators coach Billy Napier after committing to transferring to Florida.
articles.headline: Former Louisiana-Lafayette offensive lineman O'Cyrus Torrence to transfer to Florida Gators

images.name: cfp trophy [608x342] - Copy
images.caption: A proposal to expand the College Football Playoff has hit repeated roadblocks.

images.name: 210721 acc phillips photo [608x342]
images.caption: ACC commissioner Jim Phillips believes that "now is not the right time to expand the College Football Playoff."

images.name: What's next for the path to CFP expansion?
images.caption: Greg McElroy and Heather Dinich discuss how the committee can eventually come to an agreement and approve a deal for CFP expansion.

articles.description: Seven months and nine in-person meetings after revealing the proposal that was initially applauded, those who created the CFP expansion plan and publicized it have been unable to implement it.

categories.description: topic for all college football playoff content

articles.headline: Inside the College Football Playoff expansion stalemate, and what comes next

article.description: Bryce Nunnelly connected with tight end Jordan Giberti for the two-point conversion in overtime that put Chattanooga on top 29-28 over The Citadel on Saturday.
article.headline: Nunnelly helps Chattanooga edge The Citadel 29-28 in OT
article.linkText: Nunnelly helps Chattanooga edge The Citadel 29-28 in OT
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Bryce Nunnelly connected with tight end Jordan Giberti for the two-point conversion in overtime that put Chattanooga on top 29-28 over The Citadel on Saturday. Chattanooga trailed 28-21 in overtime when Tyrell Price scored on a 5-yard run. On the conversion, the Mocs (2-0) went for two with Nunnelly taking the hand-off on a reverse play and throwing to a wide open Giberti in the endzone for the win. Nick Tiano threw for 347 yards and two scores, both going to Nunnelly, who finished with 268 yards on 10 catches. Price ran for a pair of touchdowns. Chattanooga had a chance to win it in regulation but Victor Ulmo missed a 34-yard field goal as time expired, sending the game into overtime tied at 21-all. The Mocs led 21-14 at halftime but went scoreless in the second half. Jordan Black threw for 90 yards and a touchdown and ran for two more scores for the Bulldogs (0-2).
